casebody.data:
Commonwealth v. Heller, Appellant. Argued April 30, 1923. Before Moschzisker, C. J., Frazer, Walling, Simpson, Kephart and Schaffer, JJ. *545Lincoln L. Eyre, for appellant.

— The act is unconstitutional: Ritter v. Rodgers, 8 Pa. C. C. R. 451; Palairet’s App., 67 Pa. 479; Com. v. Wasson, 29 Pitts. L. J. 434; Ex parte Garland, 4 Wallace 333; Cummings v. Missouri, 71 U. S. 277; Dobbins v. Los Angeles, 195 U. S. 233.

John H. Maurer, Assistant District Attorney, with him Samuel P. Rotan, District Attorney, for appellee,

cited: Wadel’s Case, 25 Pa. C. C. R. 60; Com. v. Keemer, 20 Pa. Dist. R. 983; Johnson v. State Board of Veteri*546nary Medical Examiners, 46 Pa. Superior Ct. 279; Com. T. Finn, 11 Pa. Superior Ct. 620.

May 23, 1923: Per Curiam,

We adopt the opinion of the Superior Court, and, in addition to the authorities there mentioned, cite the opinion recently filed by Mr. Justice Brandéis of the Supreme Court of the United States in Douglas et al. v. Noble, 43 Sup. Ct. Rep. 303, which shows the points here raised to be state rather than national questions.

The judgment is affirmed.
